title: Roger Welsch, ‘America’s Premier Storyteller,’ Is Dead at 85
description: Author, humorist and tractor buff, he quit academia and found fame as a correspondent from the Nebraska heartland for the CBS News program “Sunday Morning.”
dc:creator: Clay Risen
media:credit: Leah Nash for The New York Times
media:description: Roger Welsch in 2011. A master story teller and student of regional folklore, he was best known for his “Postcards from Nebraska” on television.
